quizTitle: Quadratic Factorisation: Mastery Level - Algebraic Insight
instructions: Apply factorisation techniques to evaluate expressions efficiently. Several questions require you to factorise an algebraic expression first ('hence' part) and use it to find numerical values without calculating individual variables.

questions.question: Using the identity a² - b² = (a+b)(a-b), calculate 53 × 47.
Using the identity a² - b² = (a+b)(a-b), calculate 102 × 98.
Using the identity a² - b² = (a+b)(a-b), calculate 205 × 195.
Using the identity (a+b)² = a² + 2ab + b², calculate 52².
Using the identity (a-b)² = a² - 2ab + b², calculate 97².
Calculate 67² - 33² using the difference of squares identity.
Calculate 85² - 15² using the difference of squares identity.
Calculate 125² - 75² using the difference of squares identity.
Simplify using factorisation: 37 × 42 + 37 × 58
Simplify using factorisation: 63 × 75 - 63 × 25
Calculate 99 × 99 + 99 using factorisation.
Factorise x² - 2xy + y². Hence evaluate 101.3² - 2(101.3)(1.3) + 1.3² without finding x or y.
Calculate 101² - 99² using the difference of squares identity.
Factorise x² - y² and hence evaluate 7.5² - 2.5².
Calculate 49 × 51 using the difference of squares identity.
Factorise x² + 2xy + y². Hence find the value when x + y = 37 without finding x or y individually.
questions.explanation: x² + 2xy + y² = (x + y)². Given x + y = 37, the expression equals 37² = 1369.

questions.question: A square garden has side 25 m. Another square has side 15 m. Find the difference in areas using factorisation.
Factorise (a + b)² - (a - b)² completely. Hence evaluate it when a = 105 and b = 47.
Factorise x² - y². Hence evaluate 1234² - 1233² without calculating either square.
Factorise x⁴ - y⁴ completely. Hence evaluate 5⁴ - 3⁴ using your factorised form.
